that his parents run.

Fourteen-year-old Cici hopes for a romantic summer at the beach but
instead finds herself trying to solve a murder which had occurred
there the previous year.

This haunting tale, adapted from Amy Tan's best-seller The Joy
Luck Club and enhanced by Gretchen Schields's rich, meticulously
detailed art, is a book for all to treasure.

book_title: Mind Riot : Coming of Age in Comix
Summary:
Gathers stories by alternative "comix" artists about coming
of age

When mean and angry Judd, who has never known kindness, takes to
drinking and mistreats his dogs, Marty discovers how deep a hurt can
go and how long it takes to heal.

When mean and angry Judd, who has never known kindness, takes to
drinking and mistreats his dogs, Marty discovers how deep a hurt can
go and how long it takes to heal.
Allegorical fantasy about a Lakota Indian orphan with unusual powers.

Feeling that she is neither fully human nor "Folk," a
changeling learns her true identity and attempts to find the human
child whose place she has been given.

A baby sitter and her three willful charges make a formidable team to
outwit their surprised kidnappers.

When the Monroe family brings home a bunny they find in a movie
theater while watching Dracula, Chester the cat and Harold the dog are
suspicious of the new resident and believe him to be a vegetarian
vampire when all the vegetables ...

When he decides to turn his fifth grade teacher's love of the
dictionary around on her, clever Nick Allen invents a new word and
begins a chain of events that quickly moves beyond his control.

When the pasha of Egypt sends his friend the king of France a
magnificent giraffe, accompanied by its loving keeper, the people of
France are awed and impressed, never having seen such a creature
before.

Before he began flying through to air on Christmas Eve, Santa Claus
had lots of other jobs, including delivering packages, cooking, and
being a zookeeper, in a hilarious tale for young children.

After being released from Buchenwald at the end of World War II,
fifteen-year-old Ruth risks her life to lead a group of children
across Europe to Palestine.

book_title: Night Terrors: Stories Of Shadow And Substance : Stories Of Shadow And Substance
Summary:
A collection of eleven original stories that deal with ghosts and
gangs, murders and monsters

In the latest story by the award-winning author of Snow Bound, twelve-
year-old Sammy, who is mildly retarded, runs away from home and
becomes a prisoner of Kevin, a wild kid living in the woods.

Having failed English, eighteen-year-old Steve York must generate a
paper to get credit and chooses to think and write about his own
sophomore and junior years of high school, during which he experienced
his first love and struggled with ...

Molly wants a horse of her own, but when her father's mare gives
birth to a mule, Molly changes her mind and raises the newborn.

book_title: Mommy, Would You Love Me If...?
Summary:
Little Piglet wonders if his mother will always love him, no matter
what he grows up to be.

When Lindi does not show up in the piano garden for their tea party,
Allegra is upset, as is Lindi who is waiting for her at the diner

Donald, a disfigured burn victim, helps Maria cope with her fears of
undergoing open-heart surgery, and the two become firm, mutually
supportive friends.

When the Great Storm-Cat threatens the small English village of
Mousehole, only an old fisherman's cat can soothe its fierceness
during a dangerous sea venture.

When eight-year-old Nicky dresses up as a monster for Halloween, he
gets involved in a case of mistaken identity which causes a series of
wild adventures.

book_title: The Teddy Bear Under the Bed (Real Monsters)
Summary:
When he goes to scare the bravest girl in town, a young monster is
frightened by her teddy bear.

Larger and larger groups of hippos join a lone hippopotamus for a
party.

book_title: The Day the Ants Got Really Mad (Scaredy Cats)
Summary:
When Michael's family moves into a new house built on top of a
gigantic anthill, the ants are not happy about it and are out for
revenge.

book_title: The Twelve Days of Christmas : A Pop-Up Celebration
Summary:
Cut-out illustrations re-create the traditional scenes of the holiday
season using colorful, solid backgrounds with white pop-ups, gold
foil, acetate, mylar, and a one-of-a-kind pop-up snow globe.

Three young monsters get in trouble when they visit a museum at night
and tamper with an ancient mummy.

Six years after coming to live with their grandmother, James and Sammy
Tillerman go in search of their long-lost father.

book_title: BILLY DOG'S BAD DAY: BUSY WORLD RICHARD SCARRY #3 (The Busy World of Richard Scarry)
Summary:
Billy Dog, the new kid in class, has a rough first day of school until
Huckle learns that looks can be deceiving

On this particular Halloween, the street becomes just a bit too spooky
for the young trick-or-treaters in a mildly scary tale for young
children that comes complete with thirty-nine glow-in-the-dark
stickers and die-cut carrying handle.

book_title: When Whales Exhale: And Other Poems

Summary:
Prayers from a variety of sources, arranged in sections: Praising God,
Asking for Forgiveness, Work and Study, Family and Friends, The Needs
of the World, In Time of trouble, and Prayers for Every Day.

book_title: DOING TIME NOTES FROM THE UNDERGRAD
Summary:
Each of these ten short stories focuses on a high school student's
mandatory 200 hours of community service and the youth's response
to the required project.

Great-grandmother Tandy shows Lacey a quilt that tells the story of
Lacey's ancester Hattie.

Newly arrived in Victorian San Francisco from Ireland, Shannon plans
the daring rescue of a young Chinese slave.

book_title: Juliet : Rescue at Marlehead Manor (Girlhood Journeys Book , No 2)
Summary:
In England in 1340, Juliet resents Marguerite's snooty new friend
Lady Enid, but when she learns that Enid's father has been
unjustly accused of treason she volunteers for a dangerous mission to
help clear his name.

book_title: A SUMMER PICNIC: BUSY WORLD RICHARD SCARRY #5 (The Busy World of Richard Scarry)
Summary:
Miss Honey's class has its picnic interrupted by a thunderstorm
and takes shelter in a scary cave.

book_title: The View From Saturday (Newbery Medal Winner, 1997)
Summary:
This is a tale about a team, a class, a school, a series of contests
and, set in the midst of this, four jewel-like short stories -- one
for each of the team members -- that ask questions and demonstrate
surprising answers.

The first book in the acclaimed easy-to-read series featuring Henry
and his lovable 180-pound dog, Mudge. Level 2 Ready-to-Read The first
book in the acclaimed easy-to-read series featuring Henry and lovable
180-pound dog, Mudge.

book_title: I Have Lived a Thousand Years : Growing Up in the Holocaust
Summary:
The author describes her experiences during World War II when she and
her family were sent to the Nazi death camp at Auschwitz.

An interactive learning tool for preschoolers introduces simple
concepts dealing with colors and shapes, in an easy-to-read text,
lively illustrations, and festive, reusable vinyl Bug stickers.

book_title: Compassion : Zack Lends a Hand (Adventures from the Book of Virtues)
Summary:
When Emil's house burns down, Zach is reluctant to help until
Plato the buffalo reads the fable of Androcles and the lion to
illustrate compassion.

The West Indian trickster Anancy Spiderman tries to persuade Sun-
Spirit, Water-Spirit, Earth-Spirit, and Air-Spirit to create the
world's first palm trees so that he can collect a reward from the
king.

It can be hard waiting for Mama to come home, but once she's there
it's the best time of the day. This soothing, rhythmic book
celebrates the precious rituals a mother and child perform together as
they wind down to bedtime.

book_title: STICKERS N SHAPES TINY TOW TRUCK (Stickers 'n' Shapes)
Summary:
Climb aboard the interactive funLittle Beep and Tiny Tow Truck are all
rewed up and ready to win over preschoolers everywhere.

After joining her new friends in the religious group called Fishers of
Men, Dorry finds herself immersed in a cult from which she must
struggle to extricate herself.

book_title: A Time to Keep : The Tasha Tudor Book of Holidays
Summary:
And finally, there was Christmas, the best of all âtimes to keep,â
with handmade presents, an Advent calendar, and a âbeautiful tree in a
shine of candles.â Month by month, Tasha Tudorâs delicate
illustrations bring to life the ...

A pop-up book featuring a pastry shop filled with cookies includes
such special effects as acetate stained glass and silver sparkles

book_title: The Movable Mother Goose (Mother Goose Pop-Up)
Summary:
Robert Sabuda's The Movable Mother Goose puts a new spin on
traditional nursery rhymes as they come alive in a glorious explosion
of color!

book_title: Ashley Bryan's ABC of African American Poetry
Summary:
Each letter of the alphabet is represented by a line from a poem by
different African-American poets, describing an aspect of the black
experience. A Coretta Scott King Honor book. Reprint.

Kidnapped from an Australian train station, Joella, Peter, and Liane
are taken on a rocket to the Galax-Arena, where children stolen from
Earth perform death-defying stunts for the amusement of the
inhabitants of the planet Vexak.

Run For Your Life Jessie lives with her family in the frontier village
of Clifton, Indiana, in 1840 -- or so she believes.

book_title: Even an Easter Bunny Needs Treats (Stickers 'n' Shapes)
Summary:
Juniper Bunny delivers delicious Easter treats to her friends, who in
turn give her acorns, earthworm jam, seed dogs, fish, slime pie, and
slug bug pickles, all of which are unappetizing to the hungry rabbit.
A group of babies comfort each other as a storm rages outside.

After reviewing the situation with their grandfather, the Rugrats
decide to have a yard sale in order to stop their junk from taking
over their home. Original.

book_title: The Rugrats' Potty Book : A Baby's Got to Go! (Rugrats)
Summary:
Chuckie is helped by the other babies when he has to go to the
bathroom

book_title: Pinky And Rex And The New Neighbors: Ready-To-Read Level 3
Summary:
Rex and her best friend Pinky are upset to learn that their friend and
neighbor Mrs. Morgan is moving, and it looks like a family with an
obnoxious boy named Ollie is set to move in.

When twelve-year-old Maggie attempts to rescue Hadyn during a sudden
blizzard in the Colorado mountains in 1886, both cousins change their
minds about each other.

During the final hours aboard the Titanic on her ill-fated voyage in
1912, Gavin and Karolina attempt to help others and by so doing learn
something about themselves.

Now Riva is alone. At Auschwitz, and later in the work camps at
Mittlesteine and Grafenort, Riva vows to live, and to hopeâfor Mama,
for her brothers, for the millions of other victims of the nightmare
of the Holocaust.

Fifth grader Yolonda determines to prove that her younger brother is
not a slow learner but a true musical genius in this Newberry Honor
Book from Carol Fenner.

book_title: SCARRY: CUCUMBER TO THE RESCUE - BEST FLAP BOOK EVER (Busy World of Richard Scarry)
Summary:
Based on the hit TV show, "The Busy World of Richard
Scarry", seen on Nickelodeon and Showtime, this lift-the-flaps
book contains two detective stories with more than 50 lift-the-flaps.
Full color.

book_title: Who Invited Aliens to My Slumber Party (Scaredy Cats)
Summary:
After a horoscope predicts that something weird will happen at her
slumber party, Judy suspects that the two strange girls who turn up
uninvited are actually aliens.

book_title: Heroes of the Game : True Baseball Stories
Summary:
A collection of true baseball stories featuring players from different
eras, teams, and leagues and focusing on human interest and character.

In 1847, when her mother's remarriage sends them on a difficult
journey to California, Willow is swept overboard fording the South
Platte River and must survive and search for her family.

book_title: The Seven Voyages of Sinbad the Sailor
Summary:
Recounts the adventures of Sinbad, the travelling merchant from the
Arabian Nights, who seems to have a special talent for getting
shipwrecked and escaping to tell the tale

Fifteen of today's most celebrated authors, including Judy Blume
and Lois Lowry, share their thoughts on their work, writing habits,
inspirations, and experiences in this comprehensive book with full-
color photographs.

No one believes eleven-year-old Joey, who has a reputation for telling
tall tales, when he claims to have witnessed the kidnapping of the
class bully outside their expensive New York City private school.

Caring for her two younger siblings after their unreliable mother
abandons them, fifteen-year-old Anna discovers the difficulties of
trying to be a parent.

A little boy who can't spell or ever seem to please his parents
spends a week with a kooky babysitter and makes a special friend.

In Texas in 1886, Ellen finds her desire to be a cattle rancher
discouraged by family members who do not think it a proper choice for
a girl, but she proves her worth when drought threatens the ranch.

book_title: Black Cat, White Cat: A Pop-Up Book of Opposites
Summary:
Combines mechanical pop-up devices and humorous pictures of cats to
illustrate the concept of opposites. By the author of 1 to 10 Pop-Up
Surprises and Color Surprises.

Randy finds himself caught in a dangerous situation after taking a
wrong turn on Internet that leads him straight into a perilous murder
investigation. Original.

When the dream girl he meets on the Internet shows up as a real
person, Jonah watches his totally exciting other life turn into a
nightmare.

When seventeen-year-old Ryan brags about his abilities to hack into
protected computer systems, he finds himself the target of both the
FBI and a cyberterrorist group.

Sixth-grader Marty and his family try to help their rough neighbor,
Judd Travers, change his mean ways, even though their West Virginia
community continues to expect the worst of him, in the final volume of
the Shiloh trilogy. Reprint.

Ten-year-old T.R. and his twelve-year-old brother Danny move to
Rosemary Acres with their mother and find new friends as well as a lot
of community rules to follow.

At the ball, Cinderella will have the most thrilling night of her
lifeâuntil the stroke of midnight!

Although he wants to learn all that wise old Donkey knows, Rabbit
cannot sit still to listen to the answers to his questions, but in the
end he teaches Donkey some new things.

After the Nazis destroy his family, twelve-year-old Moishe gives up
his Jewish faith, calls himself Danny, and is taken to New York where
he tries to make the best of his life in a Catholic orphanage.

Can you guess what's hiding behind each color? Lift the flaps and
watch Chuck Murphy's colors literally explode off the pages in
this eye-popping book.

When two Plains Indian children become lost, they are cared for and
guided safely home by a friendly wolf.

Fifteen-year-old Kara is summoned by King Orrik, who believes she has
the power to call down the dragons that have been plundering his
realm, and she is caught up in the fierce rivalry between Orrik and
his jealous brother Rog.

book_title: Mr. Bear Says Good Night (Mr. Bear Says Board Books)
Summary:
A baby bear says "Good night" to the world before going to
bed. On board pages.

Chronicles the adventures of eleven-year-old Caddie growing up with
her six brothers and sisters on the Wisconsin frontier in the mid-
nineteenth century.

book_title: The Three Little Wolves and the Big Bad Pig
Summary:
Eugene Trivizas's hilarious text and Helen Oxenbury's
enchanting watercolors have made this delightfully skewed version of
the traditional tale a contemporary classic.

book_title: Easy to See Why (Aladdin Picture Books)
Summary:
As she walks to the dog show with her beloved mutt, a little girl
meets several dogs and their look-alike owners.

book_title: Don't You Dare Read This, Mrs. Dunphrey
Summary:
In the journal she is keeping for English class, sixteen-year-old Tish
chronicles the changes in her life when her abusive father returns
home after a two-year absence.

Helping in the opening of a new dance studio, Ernestine and Amanda are
on the case when the studio is vandalized and consider putting aside
their differences in order to catch the culprit.

book_title: The Book of Virtues for Young People : A Treasury of Great Moral Stories
Summary:
Stories from the best-selling Book of Virtues target a younger
audience and include material from O. Henry, Tolstoy, and Guy de
Maupassant, along with tales from Aesop, poetry from Emily Dickinson,
and many other selections.

In San Francisco near the beginning of the twentieth century, Alexia
faces a moral dilemma when her con man father tries to cheat the widow
who has been like a mother to Alexia.

Emancipated by their owner's will, thirteen-year-old Evie and her
father struggle to gain Mama's freedom and to make a home for
themselves in the pre-Civil War South.

book_title: Dinosaurs And Other Fun Things Scarry Lowly Worms How Where And Why (Lowly Worm's How, Where and Why)
Summary:
Gives children basic facts about recycling, dinosaurs, mining, and
icebergs

book_title: Oceans And Other Fun Things (Lowly Worm's How, Where and Why)
Summary:
Gives children basic facts on the ocean, how paper is made, hiking,
and timepieces

What kind of playground has Grandpa taken the Rugrats to? A very
unusual one!

When eleven-year-old Kaci interrupts burglars in the process of
robbing her house, she and her nosy elderly neighbor Mrs. Banducci are
kidnapped and held hostage by the desperate and ruthless criminals.

Deciding that she needs a gorgeous role model who does everything
right, motherless Alice is disappointed when placed in homely Mrs.
Plotkin's class, until she discovers that it is what people are
like inside that counts. Reprint.

book_title: Things That Go EEK on Halloween (Real Monsters)
Summary:
When Krumm, Ickis, and Oblinas go out on Halloween night, they find
that everyone's dressed just like them! Perfect for their favorite
time of year! Full color.

Alice gets her first boyfriend the summer before she enters the
seventh grade and discovers that love is about the most mixed-up thing
that can possibly happen to you, especially since she has no mother to
go to for advice. Reprint.

When Roma the witch cannot find her hat on Halloween, she cannot make
her broom fly until she gets another, in a book with dozens of glow-
in-the-dark stickers that can be used to complete the illustrations.

When Zeena the student witch gets her cat, she discovers that she is
allergic to the little creature, in a book with dozens of glow-in-the-
dark stickers that can be used to complete the illustrations.

book_title: Blue and the Color Detectives (Blue's Clues)
Summary: Do you know the names of all Blue's friends? Play with them here!

In a future where the Population Police enforce the law limiting a
family to only two children, Luke has lived all his twelve years in
isolation and fear, until another "third" convinces him that
the government is wrong.

Kidnapped in the middle of the night from his comfortable home, a
10-year-old orphan is brought to the Broggin Home for Boys in this
"fully realized Victorian melodrama" ("Bulletin of the
Center for Children's Books").

book_title: The View from Saturday (Jean Karl Books (Paperback))
Summary:
Four students, with their own individual stories, develop a special
bond and attract the attention of their teacher, a paraplegic, who
chooses them to represent their sixth-grade class in the Academic Bowl
competition.

Poor Big Al! He just wants to make friends. And in the whole wide blue
sea you can't find a nicer fish. But because Big Al is large and
scary-looking, the little fish are afraid to get to know him. What can
he do?

When scary strangers appear at the Monroes' overnight campsite,
Chester the cat tries to convince the family's two dogs that foul
play is intended.

Blue and Steve prepare for a picnic, and Blue leaves clues as to what
kind of game she wants to play

book_title: Blues Clues Super Shaped Board Book W Flap Shape Detective (Blue's Clues)
Summary:
Blue and Steve are searching for shapes and three of Blue's clues.
Young readers can lift flaps to help them find the correct shapes and
the clues.

An early learner's best friend, Richard Scarry introduces the
concepts of opposites and shapes in this delightful duo of pop-up
books. Each book features favorite Scarry characters as well as
brightly colored pull-tabs and playful pop-ups.

A collection of brief poems about all different kinds of foods--from
cereal and oranges to pasta, potato chips, and peas.

Sixteen-year-old Denn finds himself alienating both friends and family
when he becomes obsessed with playing high-stakes poker with adult
gamblers.

book_title: Snoozers : 7 Short Short Bedtime Stories for Lively Little Kids
Summary:
Snoozy Choosers Choose Snoozers Here are seven different Boynton
bedtime stories for little listeners.

This seasonal book comes with dozens of colorful stickers to enhance
the fun of Christmas or Hanukkah. Full-color illustrations.

But will their lessons cost Mr. Larson his job? Written by the author
of the immensely popular Frindle, this is a compelling new novel about
the collision of a student in need of a teacher with a teacher in need
of inspiration.

New Year's Day 1999 brings a strange solar flare, widescale power
outages, and the death of everyone on Earth over twenty years old,
leaving desperate teenagers to face the awakened Demon called Lilith.

Following the ancient scroll of the scribes, Linda and Harold still
have hopes of defeating the Demon.

The people of Middleburg search for buried treasure around Bessledorf
Hill and the Bessledorf Hotel.

book_title: Chanukah Bugs : A Pop-up Celebration (Cover Title)
Summary:
Celebrate the eight nights of Chanukah with the Shammash Bug, the
Dizzy Dreidel Bug, and many others. Bugs fans of all ages will get in
the spirit and join in the fun with this new holiday pop-up!

book_title: Stinky Bugs (Bugs in a Box Books)
Summary:
The author of How Many Bugs in a Box? conjures up a new collection of
ten hilarious critters--including Root Beer Bug, Red Rose Bug, and
Banana Bug--each with its own scratch-and-sniff patch and flaps to
lift. Children's BOMC.

When thirteen-year-old Chrissa is sent to her paternal
grandmother's farm, she learns more about her absent father and
some of the reasons for her distant relationship with her mother.

When Nick learns some interesting information about how words are
created, suddenly he's got the inspiration for his best plan
ever...the frindle. Who says a pen has to be called a pen? Why not
call it a frindle?

A grandmother tells the story of her eventful life in early twentieth-
century Europe and her arrival in the United States after World War
II.

After his dying grandfather tries to strangle him, Jack Lund discovers
a door that leads him fifty years into the past and involves him in
events that determine his own future.

book_title: Boitano's Edge : Inside The Real World Of Figure Skating
Summary:
Olympic ice skating champion Brian Boitano describes the sport of
figure skating and his own experiences as a skater.

Having failed to get their applications in for the middle school
summer baseball league, Robbie and Trent scramble to find a sponsor, a
coach, and enough players to form their own team. Simultaneous.

Although Trent is not at all the jealous type, his teammates, Robbie
and Gloria, are making him crazy with their constant bragging and
stirring feelings inside him that he normally would not feel.
Simultaneous.

Having been hit in the face by a ball during a previous game, Tracy
tries to deal with her fear of its happening again as the Scrappers
approach the baseball championship.

Having made it to the championship, there is only one outcome they all
want in this dramatic conclusion to the team's season.

When sixteen-year-old Daly Flanagan's dance school scholarship is
in jeopardy, she decides to go on a dangerous diet.

Sophy has always been the lead dancer, but a newcomer suddenly
threatens her position--her boyfriend's sister, Inez--and the rest
of the dancers at Dance Tech try to maintain peace. Original.

Sixteen-year-old Sophy faces a painful decision when her ballroom
dancing partnership with her boyfriend Carlos threatens to interfere
with her dream of becoming a ballerina.

A trip to Sea Park takes an unexpected turn when Tommy and Chuckie
believe they must take home one of the sea creatures.

trapped in a world that time forgot Josh is hitchhiking his way from
Massachusetts to Dallas and a new life he didn't ask for and
doesn't want, when he is beaten, robbed, and abandoned beside a
remote mountain road.

After Josh is mugged, a kind woman takes him to her village to tend to
his wounds, but upon recovering, Josh soon learns of the town's
strange rules that state he is never allowed to leave, and Josh is
forced to devise a plan of escape.

Mavis tries to pursue her goal of playing fairy godmother and granting
wishes to those around her, but she finds the process trickier than
she thought.

Illustrated in a striking stained-glass style, this fresh retelling of
the classic Arthurian legend explores the magical ascension to the
throne of England by a humble boy who receives help from the wizard
Merlin. Reprint. SLJ. PW.

Feeling that she is neither fully human nor "Folk," a
changeling learns her true identity and attempts to find the human
child whose place she had been given.

book_title: PLACES I NEVER MEANT TO BE : ORIGINAL STORIES BY CENSORED WRITERS
Summary:
A collection of short stories accompanied by short essays on
censorship by twelve authors whose works have been challenged in the
past.

The Rugrat babies are off on a road trip to end all road trips when
they take a vacation to the glitz and glamour that is Las Vegas, where
they help to free some kitties--tigers--from the "Heimlich and
Bob Show."

Chuckie's friends attempt to help him find a mom for Mother's
Day since he doesn't have one of his own

Complete with photographs and drawings, this informative book provides
middle readers with a comprehensive look at the planet Mars while
discussing the theory of life existing there.

In searing, personal poems, Jane Kurtz explores what it's like to
struggle through a flood and pull your life together afterward.
Inspired by Kurtz's own flood experience, this tale is realistic
and unforgettable.

After her mother's sudden death, high school student Laura starts
hunting for information about her mother's mysterious past, and in
searching, uncovers some terrible secrets.

book_title: How I Created My Perfect Prom Date
Summary:
When the boy of her dreams invites someone else to the senior prom,
the idealistic Nicole decides to transform her grungy next-door
neighbor, Chase, into Mr. Perfect, with humorous results. Reprint.

book_title: Bugs Before Time : Prehistoric Insects and Their Relatives
Summary:
Author Cathy Camper's absorbing text, and artist Steve Kirk's
extraordinary paintings combine to re-create a world where giants
reigned.

When eighteen-year-old Miranda decides to postpone college and travel
across American instead, she encounters difficult situations which
require self-reliance and independent thinking.

Miranda, tired of always being the good girl, takes off college for a
year and heads out on the road with her friend Kirsten, where they
find a job pounding nails in the summer heat. Original.

As the waters of the Mississippi River rise with each and every
moment, Molly and Garrett risk their lives to save their collection of
nickles and pennies as it is their only hope of getting out of their
poverty-stricken world. Original.
Five short stories in which young people gain a sense of self.

Relates, from the point of view of his servant Salai, how Leonardo da
Vinci came to paint the Mona Lisa.

book_title: Becoming a Witch (Sabrina The Teenage Witch)
Summary:
On her sixteenth birthday Sabrina discovers that she is a witch, but
before she has learned to control her powers, she turns the most
popular girl at school into a pineapple.

When Tommy "catches a bug," he and his literal-minded pals
are determined to find and liberate the pest before Didi's
medicines make Tommy feel worse. Original. TV tie-in.

In her writing for a concerned teacher, sixteen-year-old Raina reveals
her troubles with a disfunctional family, life on the streets, drug
abuse, and finally an unplanned pregnancy.

The Rugrats babies become convinced that Earth is about to be invaded
by space aliens.

John and Marisol, two young 'zine writers, fall in love amid the
bohemian life of Boston and, in the process, learn how exciting and
difficult first love can be.

book_title: A Wolf at the Door : and Other Retold Fairy Tales (Aladdin Fiction)
Summary:
Gathers a collection of old fairy tales made new by various fantasy
and science fiction authors.

book_title: The Rugrats Movie Tommys New Playmate (Rugrats)
Summary:
Tommy's world is turned inside out forever by the appearance of a
new playmate in the form of what he is told to expect will be a new
baby sister.

All the students in the third grade are affected when their beloved
teacher, Mrs. Kempczinski, is suddenly hospitalized with cancer.

At night after falling asleep, Anna flies to her favorite park which
is now filled with crocodiles, monkeys, and a lion who takes her to
his secret waterfall.

Feeling that she is neither fully human nor "Folk," a
changeling learns her true identity and attempts to find the human
child whose place she had been given.

Only Oogruk, the shaman who owns the last team of dogs in the village,
understands Russel's longing for the old ways and the songs that
celebrated them.

book_title: M C HIGGINS THE GREAT (Aladdin Fiction)
Summary:
As a slag heap, the result of strip mining, creeps closer to his house
in the Ohio hills, fifteen-year-old M.C. is torn between trying to get
his family away and fighting for the home they love.

book_title: MRS FRISBY AND THE RATS OF NIMH
Summary:
Mrs. Frisby, a widowed mousewith four small childen, is faced with a
terrible problem.

book_title: Love Finds a Home (Oke, Janette, Love Comes Softly Series, Bk. 8.)
Summary:
Belinda once more faces difficult decisions about her life, as her
aunt Virgie dies and she encounters someone she never thought she
would see again.

Presents tips on how to save money on groceries and other household
goods and ways to create a workable household budget, all the while
allowing a family to share their bounty with those in need. Original.

In The Sacrifice, Leah Ebersol has no choice but to believe the worst:
Her older sister, Sadie--and Leah's own beloved Jonas--have
betrayed her.

Beverly Lewis Bestseller, Beautifully Repackaged In The Prodigal, Leah
Ebersol knows all too well that the truth can be thorny, even
heartbreaking.

When Sadie Ebersol abandons the Amish community with her sister
Leah's beloved Jonas, the family of four sisters is thrown into
turmoil, forcing Leah to make difficult choices between her happiness
and her loyalty to those closest to her.

Before she can be courted, tragedy befalls Leah, forcing her to choose
between her happiness and her family. Abram's Daughters book 3.

have gone through life ignorant of their problems because of the
